text:
Ahh nice! All sounds good!

For masking stuff I sometimes use a Multiply (math) node.  I then pipe a roto node into the mask, then change the value of the multiply down to 0. Then I draw my roto shape in the roto node.  The area inside the roto shape will then be multiplied by 0 and thus will not be there when it gets merged over. You can also invert the roto pope if the shape would be massive. Does that make sense? Feel free to send me the script if you want any pointers on how I would tackle it!

With Nuke there is a million and 1 ways to do everything so it’s just all about knowing the right workflow to use for the situation you’ve got

Cheers mate :+1:

I'll give it another crack sometime tomorrow (had to do some lovely writeup today... Fun times) if I can't end up doing it I'll send you the script over then, thank you :+1: 

Okay got ya. Was thinking there must be, feeling more confident in it though each time I get into it which is good.
